responses: {"useful_question":"2","enjoy_question":"2","easy_to_follow_question":"1","comment":"Four twenty-somethings gossiping about famous people. The captions were difficult to follow and know who was talking and what was happening."}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"2","easy_to_follow_question":"2","comment":"Two interviewers talking with actors about each other. The captions gave content but were hard to assign to who was speaking, especially people off camera"}

{"useful_question":"2","enjoy_question":"2","easy_to_follow_question":"2","comment":"People on a morning show were discussing math maybe. There was too much information in the captions and they weren't spaced and pause so hard to follow"}

{"useful_question":"1","enjoy_question":"1","easy_to_follow_question":"2","comment":"I'm not sure what the panelists were discussing. Captions were so distracting I didn't pay attention to the conversation."}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"4","easy_to_follow_question":"4","comment":"Interview with a new dad about his wife and their children. Captions were large and aligned with the interviewer and interviewee which made it easier to follow but I didn't use the emojis"}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"3","easy_to_follow_question":"4","comment":"They were discussing technology and AI and some of the risks. Captions were clear and easy to read and I could follow who was talking (Man One and Man Two) because of how they aligned with each speaker."}

{"useful_question":"2","enjoy_question":"2","easy_to_follow_question":"2","comment":"Nick Jonas was answering rapid-fire questions with a timer. Concepts were split up over two screens which made it hard to grasp the full concepts; and interviewer and interviewee captions weren't separated - also hard to follow"}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"2","easy_to_follow_question":"2","comment":"Hoda and Jenny were discussing the new Mr. Rogers film. The colors were still distracting but I was more comfortable with them this time - the different colors weren't helpful with just two people."}

{"useful_question":"4","enjoy_question":"4","easy_to_follow_question":"5","comment":"Two musicians talking with Ellen about recording and producing an album. The large captions and the alignment with the person speaking both were helpful."}

{"useful_question":"2","enjoy_question":"1","easy_to_follow_question":"1","comment":"Interviewer asking questions. Captions were in small bites and not full thoughts on the screen and the choppiness made it hard to follow. Also times when the captions were for someone who wasn't on the screen which was very distracting"}

{"useful_question":"2","enjoy_question":"2","easy_to_follow_question":"3","comment":"Kathie Lee Gifford was sharing what it was like to live in Nashville. I could follow the captions but there weren't full concepts on the screen and sometimes concepts from two people which made it harder to follow."}

{"useful_question":"3","enjoy_question":"2","easy_to_follow_question":"3","comment":"Two actors talking about being in a new Marvel film. The colors were still distracting but I was able to use them to follow who was speaking. The contrast made it harder"}
